content.latex: K_t = \frac{\text{maximum stress}}{\text{nominal stress at throat section}}

content.text: Stress concentrated where there is variation in geometry.

content.description: A cylindrical bar with a sudden change in cross-section (notch) and a tapering bar, both illustrating areas where stress concentration occurs. An arrow points to 'stress concentration' near the notch.
content.label: Stress Concentration Illustration

content.description: A 3D cube with a circular hole through its center, perpendicular to one face.

content.text: Ques: find the maximum stress induced in the following cases:

content.description: Two 3D cubes. The first cube is plain. The second cube has a circular hole of diameter 12 and is subjected to a 12 kN tensile force on its right face. Dimensions of the cube are indicated as 60 and 40.

content.latex: K_t = \frac{\text{Maxm Stress}}{\text{Nominal Stress at net section}}
